name: HD 80653
scenarioDescription:
The HD 80653 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 80653 is a star with 1.18 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.22 times its radius. It is located 358.31 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.67 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 80653 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 80653 system


HD 80653 b

HD 80653 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 80653 b is 5.60316 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 80653 b is 1.613 that of Earth. At 5.60316 Earth masses, HD 80653 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 80653, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
